function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Incomplete integration of agency into virtual humans to incorporate dynamics of human behaviour within the building.","Impact":"Inaccurate simulation of virus transmission and ineffective space design and facility planning.","Mitigation":"Develop a comprehensive model of human behaviours in the built environment and integrate it into the system.","Technologies":"AI and machine learning for modeling human behaviors, IoT for data collection, simulation software for testing.","People":"Designers, architects, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology companies."},{"Description":"Neglecting to incorporate contextual information in the building model for human behaviour simulation.","Impact":"Inadequate reflection of the contexts of interaction, leading to inaccurate analysis of virus transmission.","Mitigation":"Ensure that contextual information is embedded in the building model, such as environmental factors, social dynamics, and situational characteristics.","Technologies":"Building Information Modeling (BIM), IoT sensors for data collection, simulation software for testing.","People":"Architects, system developers, public health officials.","Owner":"Architectural firms, research institutions."},{"Description":"Relying solely on macro-level mobility aspects in the simulation without considering micro-level interactions within environments.","Impact":"Failure to capture the complexity and randomness of interactions leading to infection, resulting in inadequate space and facility planning.","Mitigation":"Develop a system that incorporates both macro-level and micro-level interaction simulations, considering individual and group behaviors within the built environment.","Technologies":"Simulation software, IoT sensors, AI for behavior modeling.","People":"Health experts, facility planners, designers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, technology companies."}]}
